page.title: 20Adult Education Colleges
page.content: MANRESA HOUSE is part of Garnett College which provides courses for teachers of students aged 16 and over. Manresa House, designed 1760, stands in 12 acres of grounds overlooking Richmond Park. It has teaching rooms and sports facilities. Students reside in single study-bedrooms in the finely appointed 18th century house called Mount Clare (1772) in Minstead Gardens, and also in an adjoining modern annex. MANRESA HOUSE also houses the local Adult Education Institute. This provides a large variety of vocational and leisure courses for the general public. Some courses take place in another building on the housing estate called the Alton Centre where there are Playgroup and Creche facilities. The aim is to attract socially deprived people in order to enrich their lives by companionship and education.
